data.representation.sparse

Class BOWDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.representation.DataSet
      • data.representation.sparse.BOWDataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BOWDataSet
extends DataSet
    This class implements a document corpus data holder. DataInstance objects are all sparse bag-of-words representations.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • insertWord

        public int insertWord(java.lang.String word)
        Inserts the word if it doesn't exist in the vocabulary and returns its index. If it already exists, just returns the existing index.
        Parameters:
        word - String that is the word to insert.
        Returns:
        The index of the word in the vocabulary.

      • insertWord

        public int insertWord(java.lang.String word,
             float freq)
        Inserts the word if it doesn't exist in the vocabulary and returns its index. If it already exists, just returns the existing index. The frequency is updated based on the freq parameter.
        Parameters:
        word - String that is the word to insert.
        freq - Float value that is the word's frequency to insert.
        Returns:
        The index of the word in the vocabulary.

      • increaseFrequency

        public void increaseFrequency(int index,
                     float freq)
        Increases the frequency of a word in the corpus.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the word to increase the frequency of.
        freq - Float value that is the frequency increment.

      • printToSparseMatrixFile

        public void printToSparseMatrixFile(java.lang.String path)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Prints the sparse DataSet to a sparse matrix file that has in each line the index of the instance, the index of the word and the frequency, separated by whitespace.
        Parameters:
        path - String that is the file path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • loadFromSparseMatrixFile

        public void loadFromSparseMatrixFile(java.lang.String path,
                            int offset,
                            int featOffset)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads the sparse corpus from the sparse matrix file that has in each line the index of the instance, the index of the word and the frequency, separated by whitespace. This load overwrites any data previously in this corpus. Additionally, no words are available in this load, so they are generated from the integer indexes.
        Parameters:
        path - String that is the file path.
        offset - Integer that is the instance index offset, the difference in indexing protocols.
        featOffset - Integer that is the feature index offset, the difference in indexing protocols.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • printVocabulary

        public void printVocabulary(java.lang.String path)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Prints out the vocabulary of words in this corpus.
        Parameters:
        path - String that is the output file path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • loadVocabulary

        public void loadVocabulary(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads the word vocabulary from the file. Each word/frequency pair is on a separate line, separated by whitespace. The first line contains the information on the total number of words.
        Parameters:
        path - String that is the input file path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • removeWord

        public void removeWord(java.lang.String word)
        Removes a word from all sparse representations in the corpus. It remains in the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        word - String that is the word to remove from sparse representations.

      • removeWord

        public void removeWord(int index)
        Removes a word from all sparse representations in the corpus. It remains in the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        index - Integer that is the index of the word to remove.

      • removeWords

        public void removeWords(int[] indexes)
        Removes words from all sparse representations in the corpus. They remain in the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        indexes - Integer array of indexes of the words to remove.

      • removeWords

        public void removeWords(java.lang.String[] words)
        Removes words from all sparse representations in the corpus. They remain in the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        words - String[] representing the words to remove.

      • removeWords

        public void removeWords(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words)
        Removes words from all sparse representations in the corpus. They remain in the vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        words - ArrayList representing the words to remove.

      • removeLessFrequentWords

        public void removeLessFrequentWords(int minFreq)
        Removes from the sparse representations all words that occur below the specified frequency threshold.
        Parameters:
        minFreq - Minimal frequency of words that will remain in the sparse representations after the removal.
